abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The macOS 10.15 SDK provides support for developing apps for Macs running macOS Catalina 10.15. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 11 available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 11, see
During installation of macOS 10.15 you might be prompted to enter your administrator password multiple times to allow installation to proceed. (51206649)
macOS frameworks are now thinned for the x86-64 architecture. Apps that execute i386 code now fail with the
error code. The remaining stub frameworks are nonfunctional and exist only for compatibility purposes. (51236070)
AirDrop doesn’t work when a VPN is connected with the
Disconnect the VPN before using AirDrop.

To enhance security, AppleEvents and AppleScripts that target an app on a remote system must authenticate as the same user on the remote system. An AppleEvent that targets an app running as a different user receives a
error.To allow remote AppleEvents to target apps in any user session, run the following command in Terminal on the server:
Then disable and reenable Remote Apple Events in System Preferences > Sharing. (5353592)
You can now enable voice processing mode on
types to wrap a user-defined block for sending or receiving data in real-time.
A new method is available for an
based app to retrieve a list of all nodes attached to an
selects the best spatial audio rendering algorithm automatically based on the output device.
property allows system sounds and haptics to play while the session is actively using audio input.
informs apps which style of voice prompt they should play based on other audio activity in the system.
enumeration is extended to allow apps to specify route sharing policies so their audio and video is routed to the same location as AirPlay.
Audio Unit Extensions now support user presets that are available across all host apps.
framework is deprecated and remains present for compatibility purposes. Transition to
Inter-App audio is deprecated. Use Audio Units for this functionality.
Carbon component-based Audio Units are deprecated and support will be removed in a future release.
Legacy Core Audio HAL audio hardware plug-ins are no longer supported.  Use Audio Server plug-ins for audio drivers.
, which you can use to determine whether an HDR display is available and can play on the current device. (35938145)

AVFoundation now supports encoding video with alpha channels using HEVC. Videos encoded in this manner are broadly supported in AVFoundation APIs and by Safari within web pages. Technical details of the format can be found in the Interoperability Profile specification. (8045917)
The previously deprecated 32-bit QuickTime framework is no longer available in macOS 10.15.
The symbols for QTKit, which relied on the QuickTime framework, are still present but the classes are non-functional.
Apps using Picture Taker must specify the
key to access the FaceTime camera. (47916725)
initializers no longer support RAW decoder versions earlier than 6. Version 6 and later remain supported. (50911303)
Added new APIs for instantiating and modifying the built-in Core Image filters.
filter is enhanced to support models with an input or output of type
instances now support arguments with arbitrarily structured data.
instances now support returning a group of two by two pixels.

, have changed to a new set of values which are consistent across platforms. The former values remain supported for backward compatibility; however, you should avoid dependancies on specific numerical values.

After updating to macOS Catalina 10.15 Beta 7 or later, iCloud Drive might synchronize for an extended period of time. If you notice any missing files, they can be found inside a Recovered Files folder in your home folder. (54046219)
Even when Optimize Storage is switched off, iCloud Drive might fail to automatically download all files. (50667204)
When creating a new Pages, Numbers, or Keynote document in a shared folder, you might see the message “Couldn’t connect to iCloud”. (50827963)

Launch daemons and launch agents introduce new user privacy protections. Specifying privacy-sensitive files and folders in a launchd property list might not work as expected and prevent the service from running. Having
pointing to an executable in a privacy sensitive location is currently allowed, but may be restricted in a future release. (49702405)

To comply with the new privacy protections, resources for a launchd service must be stored in locations that aren’t privacy sensitive. If necessary, the app can set up resources during its execution rather than using launchd property list keys, making it possible to grant the app access using System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy. The following launchd property list keys are affected:
might be inaccurate. Instead, get the scale factor from the local trait collection. (54009624)
might not display the contents of your library. (51785735)
AppKit and Mac Catalyst apps are currently view-only clients of
and the OS Product Name is currently returned as iOS rather than macOS, which can affect diagnostic logs generated by your system. (49792004)
, each attachment might appear as two icons when viewed by the recipient. (50369995)
Controls drawn with accent color incorrectly maintain their active color when the window is inactive. There is no need to work around this in your app. (50563638)
For Mac Catalyst apps to save to Photos Library, explicitly linking the Photos framework is required. (50781430)
Action and share extensions might exhibit visual anomalies. (51005363)

All assets at 3x scale factor are currently ignored when compiling the asset catalog for Mac Catalyst apps. Because the search begins with the universal asset, assets for a specific memory or graphics class won’t be found. For example, if you provide an image and only give a 6GB and Metal 5v1 asset, it won’t be found at runtime. It’s recommended that you provide all images as vectors to allow generation of the correct scale factors, or at minimum provide 2x versions of the assets. If you’re classifying resources based on memory and graphics families then you should provide “Any Memory” and “Any Graphics”. (51033745)

When creating a Mac Catalyst app from your iPad app, Xcode automatically generates a unique Mac bundle identifier. If you have an existing Mac bundle identifier you’d prefer to use, you can do so by using manual signing in Xcode. (51076014)
Follow these steps to configure your project, AppID, and provisioning profile:
, then select Certificates, Identifiers, and Profiles.
In the Identifiers section, select your iOS app identifier to edit.
Check the Mac Catalyst capability to enable it, then click the Configure button.
Choose Use an existing macOS AppID and select the identifier you’d like to use from the popup menu. Click the Save button to finish editing your AppID.
In the Profiles section, click the
button to create a new profile, select ‘macOS App Development’, and click Continue.
Select your iOS AppID from the popup, click Continue, and complete the rest of the profile creation flow. When finished, click the Download button.
In Xcode, select your project to view the Project Editor and select your app’s target. Then select the Build Settings tab.
Set the Derive Mac Catalyst Product Bundle Identifier setting to No.
Expand the Product Bundle Identifier build setting to view its configurations.Next to the Debug configuration, click the
button to add a conditional value.

For the build setting condition, select Any macOS from the popup menu. Edit the value of the conditional build setting to match the macOS bundle identifier you want to use. Repeat this step for all  configurations in your project.
In the Signing & Capabilities tab, uncheck Automatically manage signing.
For your macOS app, select Import Profile from the Provisioning Profile popup and then select the profile you downloaded earlier.

DOM keyboard events aren’t dispatched as expected in
when pressing or releasing keys. Web apps needing to track typed characters can instead listen for DOM input events. (54580414)
If your Mac contains both macOS Mojave 10.14 and macOS 10.15 volumes, you might experience issues searching in Mail. (46611310)

API doesn’t currently support VLAN interfaces.
will see both tagged and untagged frames arriving on physical interfaces. Depending on the Ethernet driver, VLAN tags might be processed by hardware and thus stripped off the Ethernet frames thus

Support for FTP and File URL schemes for Proxy Automatic Configuration (PAC) is removed. HTTP and HTTPS are the only supported URL schemes for PAC. This affects all PAC configurations including but not limited to configurations set using Settings, System Preferences, profiles, URLSession APIs such as
SPDY support is removed from the
APIs. Servers should use HTTP 2 or HTTP 1.1. (43391641)
The Network Kernel Extension API is now deprecated. (49284108)
on privacy-protected filesystem locations has been restored to that of macOS Mojave. (47309955)
Fixed an issue where turning on Curtain Mode prevented you from being able to control a remote Mac. (52900397)
Starting in macOS 10.15, the Quartz Composer framework is deprecated and remains present for compatibility purposes. Transition to frameworks such as Core Image, SceneKit, or Metal. (50911608)

Scripting language runtimes such as Python, Ruby, and Perl are included in macOS for compatibility with legacy software. Future versions of macOS won’t include scripting language runtimes by default, and might require you to install additional packages. If your software depends on scripting languages, it’s recommended that you bundle the runtime within the app. (49764202)

Apps containing SwiftUI inside a Swift package might not run on versions of iOS earlier than iOS 13. (53706729)
: When back-deploying to an OS which doesn’t contain the SwiftUI framework, add the
flag to the Other Linker Flags setting in the Build Settings tab. See
for more information on weak linking a framework. This workaround doesn’t apply when using dynamically linked Swift packages which import SwiftUI.

SwiftUI APIs deprecated in previous betas are now removed. (52587863)

to the Identifiable protocol is removed. Change any code that relies on this conformance to pass .self to the id parameter of the relevant initializer. Constant ranges of Int continue to be accepted:

However, you shouldn’t pass a range that changes at runtime. If you use a variable that changes at runtime to define the range, the list displays views according to the initial range and ignores any subsequent updates to the range.

Command line tool support for Subversion — including
, and related commands — is no longer provided by Xcode. (50266910)

abstract.text: An object that manages a graph of audio nodes, controls playback, and configures real-time rendering constraints.
An object that simulates a 3D audio environment.
An object you use for audio generation, processing, or an I/O block.
An object that communicates to the system how you intend to use audio in your app.
Constants that indicate the prompt style to use.
Cases that indicate the possible route-sharing policies for an audio session.
An object that provides the interface to control the player’s transport behavior.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the current device can present content to an HDR display.
A notification that’s posted whenever HDR playback eligibility changes.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
An opaque type representing an audio processing graph.
A message that tells the user why the app is requesting access to the device’s camera.
Downloads a proxy autoconfiguration script and executes it.
An abstract class that declares a programmatic interface for objects that represent a telephony action.
A type of object with a publisher that emits before the object has changed.
A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
The base class that all Core Data model objects inherit from.
The type for multidimensional array features and feature values.
A font object.
A specialized view controller that provides a graphical interface for selecting media items.
Create a user interface for composing email and text messages, so users can edit and send messages without leaving your app.
An object you use to send and receive custom Ethernet frames.
The principal class for a packet tunnel provider app extension.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system excludes all traffic destined for local networks from the tunnel.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system sends most network traffic over the tunnel.
Capture touch and Apple Pencil input as a drawing, and display that content from your app.
A type that provides a collection of all of its values.
A sequence whose elements can be traversed multiple times, nondestructively, and accessed by an indexed subscript.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A signed integer value type.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
Moves all the elements at the specified offsets to the specified destination offset, preserving ordering.
A type that represents either a wrapped value or the absence of a value.
A collection that supports replacement of an arbitrary subrange of elements with the elements of another collection.
Removes all the elements at the specified offsets from the collection.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
An animation that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
A convenience for a `spring` animation with a lower `response` value, intended for driving interactive animations.

An interpolating spring animation that uses a damped spring model to produce values in the range [0, 1] that are then used to interpolate within the [from, to] range of the animated property. Preserves velocity across overlapping animations by adding the effects of each animation.
An animation that moves at a constant speed.

A persistent spring animation. When mixed with other `spring()` or `interactiveSpring()` animations on the same property, each animation will be replaced by their successor, preserving velocity from one animation to the next. Optionally blends the response values between springs over a time period.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value owned by a source of truth.
A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
The sizes that you can specify for content.
A navigation view style represented by a primary view stack that navigates to a detail view.
A collection of environment values propagated through a view hierarchy.
A binding to the current presentation mode of the view associated with this environment.
A property wrapper type that retrieves entities from a Core Data persistent store.
An environment-dependent font.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
Creates an instance that generates Rotor content by combining, in order, individual Rotor content for each element in the data given to this `ForEach`.
An alignment position along the horizontal axis.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the identifier of the underlying data.
A view that controls a navigation presentation.
A view for presenting a stack of views that represents a visible path in a navigation hierarchy.
A property wrapper type that subscribes to an observable object and invalidates a view whenever the observable object changes.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A navigation view style represented by a view stack that only shows a single top view at a time.
A view that switches between multiple child views using interactive user interface elements.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
Sets the color of the text displayed by this view.
An alignment position for text along the horizontal axis.
An alignment position along the vertical axis.
Presents an action sheet when a given condition is true.
Presents an alert to the user.
Layers the given view behind this view.
Adds a border to this view with the specified style and width.
Sets the color of the foreground elements displayed by this view.
Positions this view within an invisible frame having the specified size constraints.
Adds an action to perform when this view recognizes a long press gesture.
Adds an action to perform when this view recognizes a tap gesture.
Layers a secondary view in front of this view.
Presents a sheet when a binding to a Boolean value that you provide is true.
A picker style that presents the options in a scrollable wheel that shows the selected option and a few neighboring options.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity.
A representation of the current device.
An object that represents the current device.
A view controller that previews, opens, or prints files with a file format that your app can’t handle directly.
An object that defines the properties associated with a hardware-based display.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the system is actively cloning the screen to another destination.
The native scale factor for the physical screen.
An object that displays interactive web content, such as for an in-app browser.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
The properties you use to configure a Core ML model filter.
Creates a filter that allows the processing of RAW images.
Creates a filter that allows the processing of RAW images.
Pixel data formats for image input, output, and processing.
A 32-bit-per-pixel, fixed-point pixel format in which the alpha value precedes the red, green, and blue color components.
A GPU-based image-processing routine used to create custom Core Image filters.
A collection of unique integer values that represent the indexes of elements in another collection.
An object that enables you to start and stop URL requests.
The length of the resource data exceeded the maximum allowed.
Ignore local cache data, and instruct proxies and other intermediates to disregard their caches so far as the protocol allows.
Use cache data if the origin source can validate it; otherwise, load from the origin.
Bad CPU type in executable.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
A dictionary containing information about the proxy to use within this session.
A task, like downloading a specific resource, performed in a URL session.
